intro: Pedicularis elephas, commonly known as the giant monkey orchid, is a striking member of the Orobanchaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, particularly in areas with high altitudes and cool climates. This plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in length, featuring a distinctive hood-like structure. It thrives in rocky or alpine habitats and is often found growing in open, sunny areas. Due to its rarity and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a delicate and protected species in many regions.
